title: Georgia House - Day 23 (2026-02-26)
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the Georgia House session on 2026-02-26:

### Overview
The session featured discussions on several notable bills, including HB 156, HB 171, HB 308, SB 125, and SB 72. The proceedings included scripture readings, prayers, and reflections on the responsibilities of legislators to protect the vulnerable in their communities.

### Key Actions
**HB 156**: Bill discussed but no action taken
**HB 171**: Bill discussed but no action taken 
**HB 308**: Bill discussed but no action taken
**SB 125**: Bill discussed but no action taken
**SB 72**: Bill discussed but no action taken

### Bills Introduced (First Reading)
No new bills were introduced during this session.

### Notable Moments
- Opening prayer and scripture reading by Pastor Clint Hutchison, focusing on the responsibility of legislators to defend the vulnerable.
- Representative Lisa Hagen introduced Pastor Hutchison and discussed the work of the Mercy Ministries, a free health clinic serving the uninsured.
- Legislators were urged to make decisions that "bless" the people of Georgia and uphold moral and ethical values.

### Votes
No recorded votes took place during this session.

### Attendance
A quorum was present, with legislators instructed to vote "green" to signify their attendance.

### Adjournment
The session was adjourned. The next scheduled session was not provided.
